definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
a period of time/phase/stage/classifier for issues of a periodical, courses of study/time/term/period/to hope/Taiwan pr. [qi2]
to pay in installments/payment in installments

sentences.english: Can we buy it on instalment?
sentences.chinese: 我们可以用分期付款的方式买吗？

sentences.english: There was an evolution process in Zhou Gucheng s ancient history staging concept.
sentences.chinese: 周谷城的古史分期观有其演变过程。

sentences.english: In our history, staging refers to the era before the mid-nineteenth century.
sentences.chinese: 在我国历史分期上泛指十九世纪中叶以前的时代。

sentences.english: I read instalments of the story in the newspaper last year.
sentences.chinese: 我去年在报纸上读过这故事的分期连载。

sentences.english: She bought a set of furniture on easy terms.
sentences.chinese: 她以分期付款的方式买了一套家具。

sentences.english: The true rate of interest paid on an installment loan.
sentences.chinese: 对一笔分期偿付的贷款所支付的实际利率。

sentences.english: The deposit amount is set by the depositor and the accrued interests are paid by installment.
sentences.chinese: 存款金额由储户自定，分期支取本息。

sentences.english: I bought the house by instalment.
sentences.chinese: 我用分期付款购买房子。

sentences.english: To choose different drugs based on different stages of arthralgia syndrome.
sentences.chinese: 根据痹证不同时期的病理特点，提出分期辨证用药。

sentences.english: Payments by instalments may be accepted if the amount is large.
sentences.chinese: 数额较大的，可以分期交纳。

sentences.english: In view of the large amount involve in this transaction, we hope you'll agree to our request for installment payment.
sentences.chinese: 鉴于这笔交易数额较大，希望贵方能同意分期付款。

sentences.english: The orbital phase of our mission will be like staging two flybys per day.
sentences.chinese: 轨道阶段的任务将是两个像分期再次对准每天。

sentences.english: He's bought a car by installment.
sentences.chinese: 他用分期付款的方式买了一台汽车。

sentences.english: Over the next year, she will repay this loan in bi-weekly installments.
sentences.chinese: 一年后，她将每两周分期偿还贷款。

sentences.english: Objective To assess the value of small peripancreatic veins for staging of pancreatic carcinoma.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨胰周小静脉在胰腺癌分期中的作用。

sentences.english: Then you recover back that upfront capex over say 15 years as mentioned in the article.
sentences.chinese: 然后如文章所提到的你在15年内分期收回预付资本。

definition: to pay in installments/payment in installments
a loan/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/to provide a loan (e.g. bank)/to raise a loan (from e.g. a bank)
Ant Check Later, consumer credit service offered by Ant Financial Services 螞蟻金服|蚂蚁金服[Ma3 yi3 Jin1 fu2]
a mortgage (loanword via Cantonese)/to buy property on a mortgage
to pay a sum of money/payment
to be overdue/to fail to meet a deadline/to be behind in doing sth
